asClass.name: BodiesInit
asClass.description:
This initializer creates bodies with a random choice of body and shape definition, and then attaches them to particles for later use with BodyRenderer. The particles velocity and position are copied over, allowing you to use Flint's usual suite of initializers as well as rigid bodies.

If you wish to do further initialization, create a new initializer, and ensure it has lower default priority than BodyInitializer.
asClass.shortDescription: This initializer creates bodies with a random choice of body and shape definition, and then attaches them to particles for later use with BodyRenderer.

constructor.name: BodiesInit
constructor.description: Creates a new initializer, attached to the given world.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a new initializer, attached to the given world.

param.name: world
param.description: The world attached to.

param.name: bodyDefs
param.description: The array or FastWeightedArray to choose body defs from.

param.name: shapeDefs
param.description: An array or FastWeightedArray of arrays of b2ShapeDef to create inside the body.

param.name: scale
param.description: The scaling factor to use in pixels/unit for initializing the position and velocity of the body given the particle properties.

field.name: bodyDefs
field.description: The array or FastWeightedArray to choose body defs from. SetMassFromShapes is always used to define the body mass.
field.shortDescription: The array or FastWeightedArray to choose body defs from.

field.name: scale
field.description: The scaling factor to use when initialzing body properties from particle properties.
field.shortDescription: The scaling factor to use when initialzing body properties from particle properties.

field.name: shapeDefs
field.description: An array or FastWeightedArray of arrays of b2ShapeDef to create inside the body.
field.shortDescription: An array or FastWeightedArray of arrays of b2ShapeDef to create inside the body.

asClass.name: CircleInit
asClass.description: This initializer creates bodies with a single circle shape inside, and then attaches them to particles. You need to set the particles radius with CollisionRadiusInit.
asClass.shortDescription: This initializer creates bodies with a single circle shape inside, and then attaches them to particles.

param.name: world
param.description: The world attached to.

param.name: scale
param.description: The scaling factor to use in pixels/unit for initializing the position and velocity of the body given the particle properties.

asClass.name: Physics
asClass.description:
This activity creates a Box2D world, and manages the interaction between particles and the world. This class is mainly for convenience, providing a way to add true physics to an Emitter with the least fuss.

It is still necessary to initialize particles with a body, using one of the provided initializers.
asClass.shortDescription: This activity creates a Box2D world, and manages the interaction between particles and the world.

field.name: positionIterations
field.description: Stability parameter for position correction.
field.shortDescription: Stability parameter for position correction.

field.name: velocityIterations
field.description: Stability parameter for velocity resolution.
field.shortDescription: Stability parameter for velocity resolution.

field.name: world
field.description: The physical world. You need this reference for initializers.
field.shortDescription: The physical world.

asClass.name: BodyZone
asClass.description: A BodyZone allows 2D particles to be picked randomly from inside a body.
asClass.shortDescription: A BodyZone allows 2D particles to be picked randomly from inside a body.

param.name: body
param.description: The body get shapes from.

param.name: byMass
param.description: Scaling factor between Flint pixels and Box2D units in pixels/unit.

param.name: local
param.description: Should random locations be weighted by mass or by area.

param.name: scale
param.description: If true, points are considered in the bodies local co-ordinates, not world co-ordinates.

method.name: contains
method.description: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone.
method.shortDescription: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone.
method.result: true if point is inside the zone, false if it is outside.

param.name: x
param.description: The x coordinate of the location to test for.

param.name: y
param.description: The y coordinate of the location to test for.

method.name: getArea
method.description: The getArea method returns the size of the zone. It's used by the MultiZone class to manage the balancing between the different zones.
method.shortDescription: The getArea method returns the size of the zone.

method.name: getLocation
method.description: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone.
method.shortDescription: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone.
method.result: a random point inside the zone.

method.name: getShapeWeights
method.description: Returns a FastWeightedArray with an entry for each shape in the body, and weightings according to mass or volume.
method.shortDescription: Returns a FastWeightedArray with an entry for each shape in the body, and weightings according to mass or volume.

field.name: body
field.description: The body to pick points from.
field.shortDescription: The body to pick points from.

field.name: byMass
field.description: Are points randomly weighted by mass, or by volume.
field.shortDescription: Are points randomly weighted by mass, or by volume.

field.name: local
field.description: Is the returned point in local or world co-ordinates.
field.shortDescription: Is the returned point in local or world co-ordinates.

field.name: scale
field.description: The scale factor between Flint pixels and Box2D units, in pixels/unit.
field.shortDescription: The scale factor between Flint pixels and Box2D units, in pixels/unit.

asClass.name: BodyRenderer
asClass.description: Kinematic controller sets b2Body objects according to the motion of Particles. Particles need to have a body defined by an appropriate initializer, and must be 2D particles.
asClass.shortDescription: Kinematic controller sets b2Body objects according to the motion of Particles.

param.name: world
param.description: The world to be "rendered" to.

param.name: scale
param.description: A scaling factor between Flint's pixel co-ordinates and Box2D's units, in pixels/unit.

method.name: removeParticle
method.description: The removeParticle method is called when a particle is removed from one of the emitters that is being rendered by this renderer.
method.shortDescription: The removeParticle method is called when a particle is removed from one of the emitters that is being rendered by this renderer.

param.name: particle
param.description: The particle.

method.name: renderParticles
method.description: The renderParticles method is called during the render phase of every frame if the state of one of the emitters being rendered by this renderer has changed.
method.shortDescription: The renderParticles method is called during the render phase of every frame if the state of one of the emitters being rendered by this renderer has changed.

param.name: particles
param.description: The particles being managed by all the emitters being rendered by this renderer. The particles are in no particular order.

field.name: BODY_KEY
field.description: Use this key to look up the corresponding body of a particle in its dictionary.
field.shortDescription: Use this key to look up the corresponding body of a particle in its dictionary.

field.name: OWNSBODY_KEY
field.description: Use this key to look up the owns body value of a particle in its dictionary. The actual value is a boolean determing if the body should be destroyed when the particle is.
field.shortDescription: Use this key to look up the owns body value of a particle in its dictionary.

field.name: defaultScale
field.description: Setting this value saves the effort of specifying the scale parameter in a lot of constructors.
field.shortDescription: Setting this value saves the effort of specifying the scale parameter in a lot of constructors.

asClass.name: BodyInit
asClass.description:
This initializer creates bodies with the given body and shape def, and then attaches them to particles for later use with BodyRenderer. The particles velocity and position are copied over, allowing you to use Flint's usual suite of initializers as well as rigid bodies.

If you wish to do further initialization, create a new initializer, and ensure it has lower default priority than BodyInitializer.
asClass.shortDescription: This initializer creates bodies with the given body and shape def, and then attaches them to particles for later use with BodyRenderer.

constructor.name: BodyInit
constructor.description: Creates a new initializer, attached to the given world.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a new initializer, attached to the given world.

param.name: world
param.description: The world attached to.

param.name: bodyDef
param.description: The definition used to create bodies for each particle

param.name: shapeDefs
param.description: An array of b2ShapeDef to create inside the body.

param.name: scale
param.description: The scaling factor to use in pixels/unit for initializing the position and velocity of the body given the particle properties.

field.name: bodyDef
field.description: The body definition used to create bodies. SetMassFromShapes is always used to define the body mass.
field.shortDescription: The body definition used to create bodies.

field.name: scale
field.description: The scaling factor to use when initialzing body properties from particle properties.
field.shortDescription: The scaling factor to use when initialzing body properties from particle properties.

field.name: shapeDefs
field.description: An array of b2ShapeDef used to fill the body with shapes.
field.shortDescription: An array of b2ShapeDef used to fill the body with shapes.

field.name: world
field.description: The world which bodies will be created for.
field.shortDescription: The world which bodies will be created for.

asClass.name: Collide
asClass.description:
Collide method updates particles containing bodies with the position and velocities of the body. In other words, the inverse action to BodyRenderer.

By applying this action, particles will move according to the underlying bodies. If you have both the action and BodyRenderer, then particles will move according to both Box2D collision resolution and other particle actions.
asClass.shortDescription: Collide method updates particles containing bodies with the position and velocities of the body.

method.name: createParticles2DFromBodies
method.description: Wraps each body in a Particle2D.
method.shortDescription: Wraps each body in a Particle2D.

param.name: bodies
param.description: bodies An array of b2Body.

param.name: ownsBody
param.description: ownsBody If true, the body is destroyed when the particle dies.

param.name: factory
param.description: factory An optional particle factory to use to generate the particles.

asClass.name: b2Graphics
asClass.description: A re-implementation of debug drawing without the hassles of Box2D's API. By drawing into Sprites which you persist through frames, the methods here are appropriate for production release.
asClass.shortDescription: A re-implementation of debug drawing without the hassles of Box2D's API.

constructor.name: b2Graphics
constructor.description: Creates a wrapper for Graphics, with it's own set of drawing properties.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a wrapper for Graphics, with it's own set of drawing properties.

param.name: graphics
param.description: The Graphics object to wrap.

param.name: physScale
param.description: The scaling to use, in pixels/unit.

method.name: drawBody
method.description: Draws a body, including styling.
method.shortDescription: Draws a body, including styling.

method.name: drawBodyLocal
method.description: Draws a body in local co-ordinates, including styling.
method.shortDescription: Draws a body in local co-ordinates, including styling.

method.name: drawBodyOutline
method.description: Draws the given body, without setting any style properties. Use this instead of drawBody if you want a more customized looking shape.
method.shortDescription: Draws the given body, without setting any style properties.

method.name: drawBodyOutlineLocal
method.description: Draws the given body in local cordinates, without setting any style properties. Use this instead of drawBodyLocal if you want a more customized looking shape.
method.shortDescription: Draws the given body in local cordinates, without setting any style properties.

method.name: drawJoint
method.description: Draws a joint, including styling.
method.shortDescription: Draws a joint, including styling.

method.name: drawJointOutline
method.description: Draws the given joint, without setting any style properties. Use this instead of drawJoint if you want a more customized looking shape.
method.shortDescription: Draws the given joint, without setting any style properties.

method.name: drawSegment
method.description: Draws an unstyled line.
method.shortDescription: Draws an unstyled line.

method.name: drawShapeOutline
method.description: Draws the given shape in world co-ordinates, without setting any style properties. Use this instead of drawShape if you want a more customized looking shape.
method.shortDescription: Draws the given shape in world co-ordinates, without setting any style properties.

method.name: drawShapeOutlineLocal
method.description: Draws the given shape in local co-ordinates, without setting any style properties. Use this instead of drawShapeLocal if you want a more customized looking shape.
method.shortDescription: Draws the given shape in local co-ordinates, without setting any style properties.

method.name: drawWorld
method.description: Draws a world, including styling. Note that it is more efficient to draw bodies into separate DisplayObjects once, and then move them around, than to call drawWorld once per frame.
method.shortDescription: Draws a world, including styling.

field.name: awakeColor
field.description: The color to use for awake dynamic bodies.
field.shortDescription: The color to use for awake dynamic bodies.

field.name: fillAlpha
field.description: The alpha to use for filling in bodies.
field.shortDescription: The alpha to use for filling in bodies.

field.name: graphics
field.description: The wrapped Graphics to draw to.
field.shortDescription: The wrapped Graphics to draw to.

field.name: jointColor
field.description: The color to use for drawing joints.
field.shortDescription: The color to use for drawing joints.

field.name: lineThickness
field.description: The line thickness to use for drawing, in pixels.
field.shortDescription: The line thickness to use for drawing, in pixels.

field.name: physScale
field.description: The scale between pixels and Box2D units, in pixels/unit.
field.shortDescription: The scale between pixels and Box2D units, in pixels/unit.

field.name: sleepColor
field.description: The color to use for sleeping dynamic bodies.
field.shortDescription: The color to use for sleeping dynamic bodies.

field.name: staticColor
field.description: The color to use for static bodies.
field.shortDescription: The color to use for static bodies.

field.name: xformScale
field.description: The size to draw xforms at, in units.
field.shortDescription: The size to draw xforms at, in units.

asClass.name: b2XML
asClass.description:
Contains functions for loading Box2D shapes, bodies and joints from a simple XML format.

The XML format is formally defined in using Relax NG in the file box2d.rng found in the same directory as this class. An XML Schema file is also available, autotranslated by Trang.

Simply stated, the XML format has a root <world/> element. Inside that, there are various body and joint elements, and inside each body element is various shape elements, thus matching Box2Ds design layout quite closely. See the methods loadShapeDef, loadBodyDef, and loadJointDef for the details on how each element is formed.

In general, attribute names match exactly the corresponding Box2D property, and has the same defaults as Box2D. Reasonable values are generated for certain properties when not specified, in the same manner as the various Initialize functions of Box2D. Joint anchors can be specified in either world or local co-ordinates, either single or jointly, though this implementation will not prevent you from overspecifying attributes.

It is expected that in most cases, you will not want to use the XML to fully define worlds using loadWorld, as this library doesn't provide any mechanism for handling other data, such as the appearance of a body. Instead, you can use the various loading functions to synthesize your own XML format containing parts of the Box2D XML specification. Or you can simply use this class as a more consise and portable way of writing out defintions, and deal with defining the world in your own way.
asClass.shortDescription: Contains functions for loading Box2D shapes, bodies and joints from a simple XML format.

method.name: loadBody
method.description: Creates a body from a <body/> element with nested shape elementss, using the definitions from loadBodyDef and loadShapeDef.
method.shortDescription: Creates a body from a <body/> element with nested shape elementss, using the definitions from loadBodyDef and loadShapeDef.
method.result: A newly created body in world.

param.name: xml
param.description: The <body/> element to parse.

param.name: world
param.description: The world to create the body from.

param.name: bodyDef
param.description: The base body definition to use for defaults.

param.name: shapeDef
param.description: The base shape definition to use for defaults.

method.name: loadBodyDef
method.description:
Converts a <body/> element into a b2BodyDef.

The following attributes are recognized, corresponding directly to the b2BodyDef properties:

   allowSleep       Boolean
   angle            Number
   angularDamping   Number
   fixedRotation    Boolean
   isBullet         Boolean
   isSleeping       Boolean
   linearDamping    Number
   center           b2Vec2
   I                Number
   mass             Number
   x                Number
   y                Number
   position         b2Vec2
   userData         *
method.shortDescription: Converts a <body/> element into a b2BodyDef.

param.name: body
param.description: An XML element in the above format.

param.name: base
param.description: A body definition to use as the default when an XML attribute is missing.

method.name: loadBool
method.description: Loads a Boolean from a given attribute. Only the value "true" is recognized as true. Everything else is false.
method.shortDescription: Loads a Boolean from a given attribute.

param.name: attribute
param.description: An attribute list of zero or one attributes to parse into a Boolean.

param.name: defacto
param.description: The default number to use in case there is no attribute.

method.name: loadFloat
method.description: Loads a Number from a given attribute.
method.shortDescription: Loads a Number from a given attribute.

param.name: attribute
param.description: An attribute list of zero or one attributes to parse into a Number.

param.name: defacto
param.description: The default number to use in case there is no attribute or it is not a valid Number.

method.name: loadInt
method.description: Loads a int from a given attribute.
method.shortDescription: Loads a int from a given attribute.

param.name: attribute
param.description: An attribute list of zero or one attributes to parse into a int.

param.name: defacto
param.description: The default number to use in case there is no attribute or it is not a valid int.

method.name: loadJointDef
method.description:
Converts an XML element into a b2JointDef.

The following elements and attributes are recognized:

   <gear/>    b2GearJointDef
           ratio           Number
           joint1          String    (resolved)
           joint2          String    (resolved)
   
   <prismatic/> b2PrismaticJointDef
           motorSpeed      Number
           maxMotorForce   Number
           enableMotor     Boolean   (automatically set)
           lower           Number
           upper           Number
           enableLimits    Boolean   (automatically set)
           referenceAngle  Number    (automatically set)
           world-axis      b2Vec2
           local-axis1     b2Vec2
   
   <revolute/>    b2RevoluteJointDef
           motorSpeed      Number
           maxMotorTorque  Number
           enableMotor     Boolean   (automatically set)
           lower           Number
           upper           Number
           enableLimits    Boolean   (automatically set)
           referenceAngle  Number    (automatically set)
   
   <distance/>    b2DistanceJointDef
           dampingRatio    Number
           frequencyHz     Number
           length          Number    (automatically set)
   
   <pulley/> b2PulleyJointDef
           ratio           Number
           maxLength1      Number
           maxLength2      Number
           world-ground    b2Vec2
           world-ground1   b2Vec2
           world-ground2   b2Vec2
           length1         Number    (automatically set)
           length2         Number    (automatically set)
   
   <mouse/>    b2MouseJointDef
           dampingRatio    Number
           frequencyHz     Number
           maxForce        Number
           target          b2Vec2

Additionally, all elements support the following attributes:

   body1             String          (resolved)
   body2             String          (resolved)
   world-anchor      b2Vec2
   world-anchor1     b2Vec2
   world-anchor2     b2Vec2
   local-anchor1     b2Vec2
   local-anchor2     b2Vec2
   collideConnected  Boolean

Note that if the joint does not have a well defined body from body1/body2 or via providing base, then world co-ordinates cannot be used, except for the ground anchors of a pulley joint.
method.shortDescription: Converts an XML element into a b2JointDef.

param.name: joint
param.description: An XML element in the above format

param.name: resolver
param.description: A function mapping strings to b2Bodys (and b2Joint). This is used so that the body1 and body2 (and joint1 and joint2 from <gear/>) can get resolved to the correct references. You can avoid using this if these properties are not defined, and providing them via base.

param.name: base
param.description: A joint definition to use as the default when an XML attribute is missing.

method.name: loadShapeDef
method.shortDescription: Converts an XML element into a b2ShapeDef.

param.name: shape
param.description: An XML element in the above format

param.name: base
param.description: A shape definition to use as the default when an XML attribute is missing.

method.name: loadVec2
method.description: Loads a b2Vec2 from a given attribute. Vectors are stored as space delimited Numbers, e.g. "1.5 2.3".
method.shortDescription: Loads a b2Vec2 from a given attribute.

param.name: attribute
param.description: An attribute list of zero or one attributes to parse into a b2Vec2.

param.name: defacto
param.description: The default number to use in case there is no attribute or it is not a valid b2Vec2.

method.name: loadWorld
method.description:
Loads a world given a XML defintion.

xml is expected to a <world> element with child <body> and joint elements as specified in loadBodyDef and loadShapeDef. <body/> elements should have children shape elements as specified in loadShapeDef.

Both body and joint elements can have an id attribute that gives a string identifier to be later resolved for use with the body1 and body2 attributes of joints, and joint1 and joint2 attribute of gear joints.
method.shortDescription: Loads a world given a XML defintion.
method.result: A function you can use to resolve the loaded elements, as defined in loadJointDef.

param.name: xml
param.description: A <world/> element in the above format.

param.name: world
param.description: A world to load into. Unlike other load functions, this function does not create an object from scratch.

param.name: bodyDef
param.description: A body definition to use for defaults.

param.name: shapeDef
param.description: A shape definition to use for defaults.

param.name: jointDef
param.description: A joint definition to use for defaults.
